title: Text Search
description:
Create a function that finds all occurrences of a substring.

## Requirements

1. Create a function `find_all(text, pattern)` that returns a list of indices
2. Find every position where the pattern starts in the text
3. Return an empty list if pattern not found

## Expected Output

```
'ana' found at positions: [1, 3]
```
starterCode:
def find_all(text, pattern):
    """Find all starting positions of pattern in text."""
    positions = []
    # Use a loop to find all occurrences
    
    return positions

# Test your function
text = "banana"
pattern = "ana"
result = find_all(text, pattern)
print(f"'{pattern}' found at positions: {result}")
hints: Use str.find(pattern, start) to find the next occurrence
Update the start position after each find
Or use a simple loop checking each position
